{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Data Analyst",
  "description": "Glovo - We&rsquo;re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you&#39;ll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Data Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Your Mission


	As a UX &amp; Pricing Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping pricing strategies, enhancing user journeys, and designing experiments that inform our decision-making.
	You will work cross-functionally with Category Managers, Product, Content, Supply Chain, and Marketing teams.


The Journey


	Analyze pricing data to monitor KPIs such as price index, KVI performance, margin contribution, and AOV trends across categories.
	Support the development and refinement of pricing strategies that balance customer affordability with profitability.
	Conduct competitive benchmarking and simulate price elasticity to inform discounting, promo funding, and strategic pricing decisions.
	Design and run A/B tests and pricing experiments to assess customer behavior and validate strategic hypotheses.
	Analyze results and translate data into actionable recommendations for commercial and product stakeholders.
	Prepare and present performance dashboards and reports to leadership and relevant teams on a weekly and monthly basis.
	Monitor catalog performance metrics including product discoverability, conversion rate, and navigation flow.
	Identify UX pain points using journey mapping, dashboards (e.g., Looker), and behavioral analytics tools such as Amplitude.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


	Experience in pricing, analytics, or UX optimization, ideally within e-commerce, Q-commerce, or FMCG sectors.
	Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and translate them into actionable insights.
	Proficiency in data tools such as Excel, Looker, Google Sheets, SQL, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
	Familiarity with UX and behavioral analytics tools such as Amplitude, Mixpanel, or Google Analytics.
	Solid understanding of A/B testing methodology and experimentation frameworks.
	Business acumen and the ability to balance customer experience with commercial goals.
	Attention to detail in catalog management, pricing structures, and UX flow.
	Strong communication and collaboration skills; able to work cross-functionally with product, marketing, operations, and supply teams.
	Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don&#39;t meet our musts don&#39;t let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.


We believe driven talent deserves;


	Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
	Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
	Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
	Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
	Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
	Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-03",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-04",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Glovo Nigeria"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Data Analyst Job at Glovo Nigeria




        
    

        
        Glovo - We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst

Job Location: Lagos

Your Mission
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As a UX & Pricing Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping pricing strategies, enhancing user journeys, and designing experiments that inform our decision-making.
	You will work cross-functionally with Category Managers, Product, Content, Supply Chain, and Marketing teams.


The Journey


	Analyze pricing data to monitor KPIs such as price index, KVI performance, margin contribution, and AOV trends across categories.
	Support the development and refinement of pricing strategies that balance customer affordability with profitability.
	Conduct competitive benchmarking and simulate price elasticity to inform discounting, promo funding, and strategic pricing decisions.
	Design and run A/B tests and pricing experiments to assess customer behavior and validate strategic hypotheses.
	Analyze results and translate data into actionable recommendations for commercial and product stakeholders.
	Prepare and present performance dashboards and reports to leadership and relevant teams on a weekly and monthly basis.
	Monitor catalog performance metrics including product discoverability, conversion rate, and navigation flow.
	Identify UX pain points using journey mapping, dashboards (e.g., Looker), and behavioral analytics tools such as Amplitude.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


	Experience in pricing, analytics, or UX optimization, ideally within e-commerce, Q-commerce, or FMCG sectors.
	Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and translate them into actionable insights.
	Proficiency in data tools such as Excel, Looker, Google Sheets, SQL, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
	Familiarity with UX and behavioral analytics tools such as Amplitude, Mixpanel, or Google Analytics.
	Solid understanding of A/B testing methodology and experimentation frameworks.
	Business acumen and the ability to balance customer experience with commercial goals.
	Attention to detail in catalog management, pricing structures, and UX flow.
	Strong communication and collaboration skills; able to work cross-functionally with product, marketing, operations, and supply teams.
	Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.


We believe driven talent deserves;


	Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
	Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
	Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
	Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
	Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
	Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

title: Job Vacancies at Royal Power and Energy Limited
content:
Royal Power and Energy Limited - We are leading power solution providers and suppliers of complementary electrical products and services such as UPS, Batteries, AVRs, Transformers, Surge Arresters, and Solar Systems. Our vast experience and in-depth knowledge in the power industry has helped our company to understand the needs of the market and offer high performance products and systems.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.)  Project Engineering Manager - Telecoms

Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Plan, schedule, and manage multiple telecom and power system projects simultaneously.
	Conduct comprehensive technical site surveys to assess project requirements, identify potential challenges, and suggest optimal solutions aligned with client needs and project specifications.
	Lead installation, testing, and commissioning of telecom rectifiers, large UPS systems, LV electrical panels, and solar systems (on-grid/off-grid/hybrid).
	Coordinate site readiness, deployment activities, and acceptance with stakeholders and clients.
	Prepare BOQs, project schedules, method statements, risk assessments, and quality plans.
	Review and validate SLDs, load calculations, wiring diagrams, and energy management systems.
	Coordinate closely with internal stakeholders, subcontractors, and vendors to ensure timely delivery, quality assurance, and adherence to project milestones and budget constraints.
	Lead and manage a team of field service engineers tasked with site surveys and project implementation. Provide guidance, support, and technical expertise to optimize team performance and ensure the successful execution of project objectives.
	Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement corrective actions where needed.
	Conduct project progress meetings, reporting, and documentation updates.
	Be willing to travel extensively to various customer site


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND, B.Sc, or B.Tech with 8-11 years of experience.


Application Closing Date: 19th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@rpeltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Service Engineer & Technician

Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Electrical contracting and services (UPS, Inverter, Servo Stabilizer)
	Experienced in installation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of Numeric UPS and other brands (up to 200 kVA) and stabilizers (up to 500 kVA)
	Knowledgeable in installation of electrical cabling and LV electrical panels
	Prepare technical specifications in accordance with contractual requirements
	Implement and coordinate electrical projects
	Deliver high-quality support services to customers
	Willing to work as a Field Service Engineer and travel extensively
	Accurately update job tickets on time
	Ensure JCCs are signed by customers and sent to Lagos HQ weekly
	Train junior engineers on UPS system repair and installation


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications.


Application Closing Date: 10th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@rpeltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Driver

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Safely drive staff and authorized persons to and from various destinations as assigned.
	Deliver and collect official documents, parcels, and other items when necessary.
	Maintain strict adherence to traffic rules and company driving policies.
	Conduct daily pre-trip inspections to ensure the vehicle is in proper working condition.
	Check oil, water, battery, brakes, tires, and fuel levels regularly.
	Ensure the vehicle is always clean (interior and exterior)
	Maintain an accurate logbook for daily trips, mileage, and fuel consumption.
	Ensure all vehicle documents (insurance, roadworthiness, registration, etc.) are valid and up to date.
	Prepare weekly reports on vehicle usage and condition.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a minimum of an SSCE certification with 5 - 10 years of relevant work experience.


Application Closing Date: 10th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@erickayserng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Customer Service & Storekeeper (Female)",
  "description": "Talent Management Alliance (TMAsourcing Solutions) is a people focused HR consulting firm committed to helping companies and businesses attract, manaage and retain the right talent.

TMAsourcing Solutions is a comprehensive HR solutions provider specializing in recruitment and tailored HR services across various industries, including Healthcare, Telecommunications, Hospitality, IT, Financial Services, Retail, Manufacturing and more. We are dedicated to connecting businesses with top talent, delivering strategic HR services that align with business goals, and supporting long term workforce and organizational success.
.We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service &amp; Storekeeper (Female)
Job Location:&nbsp;Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Days:Monday &ndash; Saturday (9:00am &ndash; 7:00pm)

Job Summary


	A fashion store in Ogudu&nbsp;is looking for a Customer Service &amp; Storekeeper (Female)&nbsp;to handle both online and in-store operations.
	The ideal candidate must be smart, proactive, neat, and able to work with little supervision.


Key Responsibilities


	Attend to customers online and in-store
	Manage stock, orders, and deliveries
	Upload and update products online/social media
	Support content posting and promotions
	Keep the store clean, organized, and tidy
	Provide excellent customer service.


Requirements


	OND/NCE/HND/B.Sc. (NYSC must be completed)
	1&ndash;3 years of experience in customer service or retail
	Female, aged 21&ndash;30 years
	Must live around Ogudu, Ketu, Ojota, Maryland, Ilupeju, Anthony, Ogba, or Ikeja
	Strong communication, computer, and social media skills
	Must be reliable, proactive, and trustworthy.


Salary
N90,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;tmasourcinghr@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Customer Service &amp; Storekeeper&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

Customer Service & Storekeeper (Female) Job at Talent Management Alliance




        
    

        
        Talent Management Alliance (TMAsourcing Solutions) is a people focused HR consulting firm committed to helping companies and businesses attract, manaage and retain the right talent.

TMAsourcing Solutions is a comprehensive HR solutions provider specializing in recruitment and tailored HR services across various industries, including Healthcare, Telecommunications, Hospitality, IT, Financial Services, Retail, Manufacturing and more. We are dedicated to connecting businesses with top talent, delivering strategic HR services that align with business goals, and supporting long term workforce and organizational success.
.We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Customer Service & Storekeeper (Female)
Job Location: Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Days:Monday – Saturday (9:00am – 7:00pm)

Job Summary


	A fashion store in Ogudu is looking for a Customer Service & Storekeeper (Female) to handle both online and in-store operations.
	The ideal candidate must be smart, proactive, neat, and able to work with little supervision.


Key Responsibilities


	Attend to customers online and in-store
	Manage stock, orders, and deliveries
	Upload and update products online/social media
	Support content posting and promotions
	Keep the store clean, organized, and tidy
	Provide excellent customer service.


Requirements


	OND/NCE/HND/B.Sc. (NYSC must be completed)
	1–3 years of experience in customer service or retail
	Female, aged 21–30 years
	Must live around Ogudu, Ketu, Ojota, Maryland, Ilupeju, Anthony, Ogba, or Ikeja
	Strong communication, computer, and social media skills
	Must be reliable, proactive, and trustworthy.


Salary
N90,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tmasourcinghr@gmail.com using “Customer Service & Storekeeper” as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Software Engineer",
  "description": "BluePeak HR Services is a trusted Human Resources consulting firm delivering recruitment and personnel management solutionsto organizations across diverse industries in Nigeria. With manyyears of proven experience, we partner with businesses to build high-performing teams and implement sustainable HR practices that drive growth.

Headquartered in Port Harcourt, Rivers State, BluePeak HR Services provides nationwide support to companies seeking reliable and efficient human capital solutions. Our team of seasoned HR professionals combines local market insight with global best practices to help clients attract, develop, and retain top talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software Engineer
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The Software Engineer will be responsible for research, design, development, and implementation of software solutions that align with the company&rsquo;s innovation goals.
	The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience in Python, SQL, and at least one additional programming language, with a strong interest in research and product development.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct research and feasibility studies on emerging technologies and software solutions.
	Design, develop, test, and deploy scalable and efficient software applications.
	Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code using Python, SQL, or other programming languages.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify software needs and deliver customized solutions.
	Develop and maintain databases, APIs, and backend systems.
	Participate in software reviews, debugging, and performance optimization.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3&ndash;5years of proven experience in software development.
	Proficiency in Python and SQL; familiarity with other programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, Java, C++, or PHP) is an advantage.
	Strong understanding of software design principles, data structures, and algorithms.
	Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development practices.
	Knowledge of database management and API integration.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N350,000 Monthly.",

Software Engineer Job at BluePeak HR Services




        
    

        
        BluePeak HR Services is a trusted Human Resources consulting firm delivering recruitment and personnel management solutionsto organizations across diverse industries in Nigeria. With manyyears of proven experience, we partner with businesses to build high-performing teams and implement sustainable HR practices that drive growth.

Headquartered in Port Harcourt, Rivers State, BluePeak HR Services provides nationwide support to companies seeking reliable and efficient human capital solutions. Our team of seasoned HR professionals combines local market insight with global best practices to help clients attract, develop, and retain top talent.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software Engineer
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The Software Engineer will be responsible for research, design, development, and implementation of software solutions that align with the company’s innovation goals.
	The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience in Python, SQL, and at least one additional programming language, with a strong interest in research and product development.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct research and feasibility studies on emerging technologies and software solutions.
	Design, develop, test, and deploy scalable and efficient software applications.
	Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code using Python, SQL, or other programming languages.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify software needs and deliver customized solutions.
	Develop and maintain databases, APIs, and backend systems.
	Participate in software reviews, debugging, and performance optimization.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3–5years of proven experience in software development.
	Proficiency in Python and SQL; familiarity with other programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, Java, C++, or PHP) is an advantage.
	Strong understanding of software design principles, data structures, and algorithms.
	Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development practices.
	Knowledge of database management and API integration.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N350,000 Monthly.
